section.title: Introduction
section.text: The Sappethoussent are a tribal species found on the planet Cottred. They are war-like and spend much of their lives in conflict with the various tribes of the Laterping species. They are also highly religious and have many customs and rituals dedicated to their pantheon of gods. Sappethoussent tribes follow a patriarchal society with a chieftain that rules with absolute authority which is derived from the mandate of Aphypopc, the patriarch of their pantheon of gods. In this work I will introduce aspects of Sappethoussent life, focusing on ritual bathing and their war with the Laterping tribes.

section.title: Ritual Bathing
section.text: Each lunar cycle starts off with ritual bathing. A tribe of Sappethoussent will travel to a hot spring within their territory. The tribe shamans and males of the tribe will form a column seven men wide and begin to dance around the hot spring to ward away evil spirits. All the while, the females of the tribe will kneel down around the hot spring in a circle seven men deep and pray to Infloal, the matriarch of their pantheon of gods. The chieftain will then enter the hot spring and be blessed by the head shaman in the name of Iverated, the god of war and patriarch of the Sappethoussent pantheon. Following the chieftain, the men will the enter the hot springs for seven minutes, followed by the women who also bathe for seven minutes. At the conclusion of the ritual bathing, the men will prepare a pyre of Sanday wood and the head shaman will place seven white comberateepes onto the pyre. The chieftain will then light the pyre marking the start of the next lunar cycle.

section.title: War with the Laterping Tribes
section.text: The ritual bathing and start of the lunar cycle marks the beginning of raids on Laterping villages by the Sappethoussent. The main duty of the chieftain is to bring wealth and prosperity to their tribe. As most chieftains are patrons of Iverated, chieftains typically aim to bring wealth to their tribes by raiding nearby Laterping tribes.
